case_vignette: A 48-year-old woman comes to the physician because of an increasingly painful swelling behind her right knee for the past 2 months. During this time, she has also had intermittent low-grade fever and she has been more fatigued than usual. She has not had any trauma to the knee. Over the past year, she has had occasional pain in her hands and wrists bilaterally. She has hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus. She drinks 1–2 glasses of wine daily and occasionally more on weekends. Current medications include enalapril, metformin, and glimepiride. Her mother and older brother have osteoarthritis. She is 165 cm (5 ft 5 in) tall and weighs 68 kg (150 lb); BMI is 25 kg/m2. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a 3-cm nontender mass in the right popliteal fossa that becomes prominent when the knee is extended. There is mild swelling and redness of her right knee joint.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having increasingly painful swelling behind my right knee for the past 2 months, and I've also been experiencing intermittent low-grade fever and unusual fatigue.
How old are you?
I'm 48 years old.
Do you have any medical conditions or are you taking any medications?
Yes, I have high blood pressure and type 2 diabetes, and I take enalapril, metformin, and glimepiride for my conditions.
Do you have a family history of any rheumatologic conditions such as arthritis or lupus?
My mother and older brother have osteoarthritis.
**Final Diagnosis:** Rheumatoid arthritis
